description: The use of the MD5 hash algorithm is insecure because it can be collision-attacked in 2^128 time.
recommendation: Use a more secure hash algorithm, such as SHA-256 or SHA-512.

description: The use of the MD5 hash algorithm without key stretching can be vulnerable to attacks that use precomputed hash tables.
recommendation: Use a key stretching algorithm, such as PBKDF2 or bcrypt, to make the hash algorithm more secure.
